meanings.definition: Developing or growing from the inside towards the outside.
meanings.sent1: The endarch roots of the plant spread outwards from the center.
meanings.sent2: The tree's endarch growth pattern ensured its stability as it expanded.
meanings.sent3: The endarch vines in the garden seemed to be playing a game of hide and seek with the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like endarch tendrils, starting deep within and slowly reaching the surface.
meanings.sent5: The endarch structure of the building made it easy to navigate from the core to the edges.

meanings.definition: Arranged in a way that the oldest parts are in the center and the youngest parts are on the outside.
meanings.sent1: The endarch layers of the archaeological site revealed its history from inside to outside.
meanings.sent2: The endarch rings of the tree displayed its growth history clearly.
meanings.sent3: The endarch arrangement of the cake layers made it look like a delicious tower.
meanings.sent4: His endarch personality showed a deep core surrounded by layers of experiences.
meanings.sent5: The endarch organization of the event had the most important guests at the center.
